required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Closed-Loop Insulin Delivery in Children Less Than 7 Years of Age
clinical_study.official_title: Closed-Loop Insulin Delivery in Children Less Than 7 Years of Age

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators are conducting this study to find out whether a new device can control blood sugar levels in children who have Type 1 diabetes. In Type 1 diabetes, children have high blood sugar levels because they do not make enough insulin. The standard treatment is to give insulin either by shots or using an insulin pump. A new device, called closed-loop insulin therapy, uses a continuous glucose monitor (CGMs) linked to an insulin pump by a computer. The CGM will send the sugar levels to a computer which automatically figures out how much insulin to give and then gives that amount of insulin through the insulin pump. It will give the child insulin to bring sugar levels down if they are high, and will give less insulin if the child's blood sugar is getting lower. Earlier research using closed-loop insulin therapy has shown the ability for it to improve diabetes care in adults and older children, but there has been no research of closed-loop insulin therapy in young children. This study will compare children's current insulin therapy with the closed-loop system. The knowledge that the investigators gain from this research will help us to figure out whether closed-loop therapy can work in young children, hopefully leading to better Type 1 diabetes care.

detailed_description.textblock: We will perform a randomized cross-over study of semi-closed-loop insulin therapy in children less than 7 years old with type 1 diabetes. Subjects will be admitted to the inpatient clinical research center for 48 hours. They will receive their standard home insulin therapy for one day and semi-closed-loop insulin therapy for the other day.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of the 48 hour protocol.
primary_outcome.description: Time spent within target glucose range based on the glucose meter measurements between 10 PM and 8 AM. The target range is 110-200 mg/dl as this is the American Diabetes Association defined target overnight range for this age group.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of the 48 hour protocol
secondary_outcome.description: Peak post-prandial blood sugar between 8 AM and noon

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of the 48 hour protocol
secondary_outcome.description: The number of interventions for hypoglycemia between 10 PM - 8 AM.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of the 48 hour protocol
secondary_outcome.description: Blood glucose levels were documented at 12 pm just prior to being served lunch.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Standard Insulin Pump Therapy first, then Closed Loop
arm_group.description: Standard therapy day 1, Closed-Loop therapy day 2.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Closed Loop first, then Standard Insulin Pump Therapy
arm_group.description: Closed-loop therapy day 1, standard therapy day 2.

intervention.description: Subjects insulin doses were adjusted based on a proportional-integral-derivative algorithm using the continuous glucose monitor readings from 10 PM - noon.
intervention.arm_group_label: Closed Loop first, then Standard Insulin Pump Therapy
Standard Insulin Pump Therapy first, then Closed Loop
intervention.other_name: Continuous glucose monitor and computer-linked insulin pump

intervention.description: Subjects insulin doses followed their usual home routine.
intervention.arm_group_label: Closed Loop first, then Standard Insulin Pump Therapy
Standard Insulin Pump Therapy first, then Closed Loop

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age < 7 years old
- Type 1 Diabetes (as diagnosed by outpatient endocrinologist) with duration greater than 6 months
- Treated with insulin pump therapy for greater than 6 weeks
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any other chronic medical condition
- Weight below 10 kg as this is the minimal required weight for the amount of blood being drawn

results_reference.citation: Dauber A, Corcia L, Safer J, Agus MS, Einis S, Steil GM. Closed-loop insulin therapy improves glycemic control in children aged <7 years: a randomized controlled trial. Diabetes Care. 2013 Feb;36(2):222-7. doi: 10.2337/dc12-1079. Epub 2012 Oct 1.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Assistant Professor of Pediatrics, Harvard Medical School

group.title: Standard Insulin Pump Therapy First
group.description: The subjects in this arm received Standard Insulin Pump therapy on day 1 followed by Closed-Loop Insulin therapy on day 2. Closed-loop Insulin therapy: Subjects' insulin dose will be adjusted based on a proportional-integral-derivative algorithm using the continuous glucose monitor readings from 10 PM - noon. Standard Insulin Pump Therapy: Patients will receive standard insulin pump therapy as per their usual home insulin protocol.

group.title: Closed-Loop Insulin Therapy First
group.description: The subjects in this arm receive closed-loop insulin therapy on day 1 followed by standard insulin pump therapy on day 2. Closed-loop Insulin therapy: Subjects' insulin dose will be adjusted based on a proportional-integral-derivative algorithm using the continuous glucose monitor readings from 10 PM - noon. Standard Insulin Pump Therapy: Patients will receive standard insulin pump therapy as per their usual home insulin protocol.

group.title: Standard Insulin Pump Therapy First
group.description: The subjects in this arm received Standard Insulin Pump therapy on day 1 followed by Closed-Loop Insulin therapy on day 2. Closed-loop Insulin therapy: Subjects' insulin dose will be adjusted based on a proportional-integral-derivative algorithm using the continuous glucose monitor readings from 10 PM - noon. Standard Insulin Pump Therapy: Patients will receive standard insulin pump therapy as per their usual home insulin protocol.

group.title: Closed-Loop Insulin Therapy First
group.description: The subjects in this arm receive closed-loop insulin therapy on day 1 followed by standard insulin pump therapy on day 2. Closed-loop Insulin therapy: Subjects' insulin dose will be adjusted based on a proportional-integral-derivative algorithm using the continuous glucose monitor readings from 10 PM - noon. Standard Insulin Pump Therapy: Patients will receive standard insulin pump therapy as per their usual home insulin protocol.

outcome.title: Nocturnal Glycemic Control
outcome.description: Time spent within target glucose range based on the glucose meter measurements between 10 PM and 8 AM. The target range is 110-200 mg/dl as this is the American Diabetes Association defined target overnight range for this age group.
outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of the 48 hour protocol.

group.title: Standard Insulin Pump Therapy
group.description: Subjects will receive standard insulin pump therapy as per their usual home insulin protocol on day 1 or 2.

group.title: Closed-Loop Insulin Therapy
group.description: Subjects insulin doses will be adjusted based on a proportional-integral-derivative algorithm using the continuous glucose monitor readings from 10 PM - noon the following day on day 1 or 2.

measure.title: Nocturnal Glycemic Control
measure.description: Time spent within target glucose range based on the glucose meter measurements between 10 PM and 8 AM. The target range is 110-200 mg/dl as this is the American Diabetes Association defined target overnight range for this age group.

analysis.groups_desc: We tested the number of nighttime (10 PM - 8 AM) hours glucose was in the target range (110-200 mg/dL) on each of the two nights for which the patient was followed (one night under Standard Insulin Pump Therapy; one night under Closed-loop Insulin Therapy)
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The null hypothesis was that the number of hours would be the same (no effect of control).
analysis.p_value_desc: Statistical analysis was performed using a paired t-test.

outcome.title: Post-prandial Glycemic Control
outcome.description: Peak post-prandial blood sugar between 8 AM and noon
outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of the 48 hour protocol

group.description: Subjects insulin doses will be adjusted based on a proportional-integral-derivative algorithm using the continuous glucose monitor readings from 10 PM - noon the following day on day 1 or two.

group.title: Standard Insulin Pump Therapy

event.description: One episode where mealtime insulin was not administered due to a nursing error. The patient was transiently hyperglycemic until an additional dose of insulin was given. This was a minor event but was unexpected. No harm came to the patient.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
